result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall L Zoromski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay fine of $100 plus costs including the DNA and Domestic Abuse surcharges. 
Bond to be applied to the fine and costs. 
To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall L Zoromski

records.addlTxt: Letter from Employer - No longer employed

Defendant Randall L Zoromski in court with attorney Brian T. Kane. Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:05 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Zell makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kane makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Pay fine of $100 plus costs including the DNA and Domestic Abuse surcharges. 
Bond to be applied to the fine and costs. 
To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

records.addlTxt: Atty Brian Kane appointed
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
No violent or abusive contact with Shawn Zoromski.

Defendant Randall L Zoromski in court. Elizabeth Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:28 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.

Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant not able to afford his own attorney at this time.
Defendant informed to complete application with public defenders office within 72 hours and they will determine if he is eligible and appoint an attorney.
If determined not eligible through public defenders office than can petition court for a court appointed attorney.

NOT GUILTY plea entered on defendant's behalf. 

State recommends a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
